41class SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded;
42
43enum InstanceType : uint16_t;
44
45enum AllowNullsFlag { ALLOW_NULLS, DISALLOW_NULLS };
46enum RobustnessFlag { ROBUST_STRING_TRAVERSAL, FAST_STRING_TRAVERSAL };
47
48// The characteristics of a string are stored in its map. Retrieving these
49// few bits of information is moderately expensive, involving two memory
50// loads where the second is dependent on the first. To improve efficiency
51// the shape of the string is given its own class so that it can be retrieved
52// once and used for several string operations. A StringShape is small enough
53// to be passed by value and is immutable, but be aware that flattening a
54// string can potentially alter its shape. Also be aware that a GC caused by
55// something else can alter the shape of a string due to ConsString
56// shortcutting. Keeping these restrictions in mind has proven to be error-
57// prone and so we no longer put StringShapes in variables unless there is a
58// concrete performance benefit at that particular point in the code.
59class StringShape {
60 public:
61 V8_INLINE explicit StringShape(const Tagged<String> s);
62 V8_INLINE explicit StringShape(const Tagged<String> s,
63 PtrComprCageBase cage_base);
64 V8_INLINE explicit StringShape(Tagged<Map> s);
65 V8_INLINE explicit StringShape(InstanceType t);
66 V8_INLINE bool IsSequential() const;
67 V8_INLINE bool IsExternal() const;
68 V8_INLINE bool IsCons() const;
69 V8_INLINE bool IsSliced() const;
70 V8_INLINE bool IsThin() const;
71 V8_INLINE bool IsDirect() const;
72 V8_INLINE bool IsIndirect() const;
73 V8_INLINE bool IsUncachedExternal() const;
74 V8_INLINE bool IsExternalOneByte() const;
75 V8_INLINE bool IsExternalTwoByte() const;
76 V8_INLINE bool IsSequentialOneByte() const;
77 V8_INLINE bool IsSequentialTwoByte() const;
78 V8_INLINE bool IsInternalized() const;
79 V8_INLINE bool IsShared() const;
80 V8_INLINE StringRepresentationTag representation_tag() const;
81 V8_INLINE uint32_t encoding_tag() const;
82 V8_INLINE uint32_t representation_and_encoding_tag() const;
83 V8_INLINE uint32_t representation_encoding_and_shared_tag() const;
84#ifdef DEBUG
85 inline uint32_t type() const { return type_; }
86 inline void invalidate() { valid_ = false; }
87 inline bool valid() const { return valid_; }
88#else
89 inline void invalidate() {}
90#endif
91
92 // Run different behavior for each concrete string class type, as defined by
93 // the dispatcher.
94 template <typename TDispatcher, typename TResult, typename... TArgs>
95 inline TResult DispatchToSpecificTypeWithoutCast(TArgs&&... args);
96 template <typename TDispatcher, typename TResult, typename... TArgs>
97 inline TResult DispatchToSpecificType(Tagged<String> str, TArgs&&... args);
98
99 private:
100 uint32_t type_;
101#ifdef DEBUG
102 inline void set_valid() { valid_ = true; }
103 bool valid_;
104#else
105 inline void set_valid() {}
106#endif
107};
108
109// The String abstract class captures JavaScript string values:
110//
111// Ecma-262:
112// 4.3.16 String Value
113// A string value is a member of the type String and is a finite
114// ordered sequence of zero or more 16-bit unsigned integer values.
115//
116// All string values have a length field.
117V8_OBJECT class String : public Name {
118 public:
119 enum Encoding { ONE_BYTE_ENCODING, TWO_BYTE_ENCODING };
120
121 // Representation of the flat content of a String.
122 // A non-flat string doesn't have flat content.
123 // A flat string has content that's encoded as a sequence of either
124 // one-byte chars or two-byte UC16.
125 // Returned by String::GetFlatContent().
126 // Not safe to use from concurrent background threads.
127 // TODO(solanes): Move FlatContent into FlatStringReader, and make it private.
128 // This would de-duplicate code, as well as taking advantage of the fact that
129 // FlatStringReader is relocatable.
130 V8_OBJECT_INNER_CLASS class FlatContent {
131 public:
132 inline ~FlatContent();
133
134 // Returns true if the string is flat and this structure contains content.
135 bool IsFlat() const { return state_ != NON_FLAT; }
136 // Returns true if the structure contains one-byte content.
137 bool IsOneByte() const { return state_ == ONE_BYTE; }
138 // Returns true if the structure contains two-byte content.
139 bool IsTwoByte() const { return state_ == TWO_BYTE; }
140
141 // Return the one byte content of the string. Only use if IsOneByte()
142 // returns true.
143 base::Vector<const uint8_t> ToOneByteVector() const {
144 DCHECK_EQ(ONE_BYTE, state_);
145 return base::Vector<const uint8_t>(onebyte_start, length_);
146 }
147 // Return the two-byte content of the string. Only use if IsTwoByte()
148 // returns true.
149 base::Vector<const base::uc16> ToUC16Vector() const {
150 DCHECK_EQ(TWO_BYTE, state_);
151 return base::Vector<const base::uc16>(twobyte_start, length_);
152 }
153
154 base::uc16 Get(int i) const {
155 DCHECK(i < length_);
156 DCHECK(state_ != NON_FLAT);
157 if (state_ == ONE_BYTE) return onebyte_start[i];
158 return twobyte_start[i];
159 }
160
161 bool UsesSameString(const FlatContent& other) const {
162 return onebyte_start == other.onebyte_start;
163 }
164
165 // It is almost always a bug if the contents of a FlatContent changes during
166 // its lifetime, which can happen due to GC or bugs in concurrent string
167 // access. Rarely, callers need the ability to GC and have ensured safety in
168 // other ways, such as in IrregexpInterpreter. Those callers can disable the
169 // checksum verification with this call.
170 void UnsafeDisableChecksumVerification() {
171#ifdef ENABLE_SLOW_DCHECKS
172 checksum_ = kChecksumVerificationDisabled;
173#endif
174 }
175
176 int length() const { return length_; }
177
178 private:
179 enum State { NON_FLAT, ONE_BYTE, TWO_BYTE };
180
181 // Constructors only used by String::GetFlatContent().
182 inline FlatContent(const uint8_t* start, int length,
183 const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc);
184 inline FlatContent(const base::uc16* start, int length,
185 const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc);
186 explicit FlatContent(const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc)
187 : onebyte_start(nullptr), length_(0), state_(NON_FLAT), no_gc_(no_gc) {}
188
189 union {
190 const uint8_t* onebyte_start;
191 const base::uc16* twobyte_start;
192 };
193 int length_;
194 State state_;
195 const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc_;
196
197 static constexpr uint32_t kChecksumVerificationDisabled = 0;
198
199#ifdef ENABLE_SLOW_DCHECKS
200 inline uint32_t ComputeChecksum() const;
201
202 uint32_t checksum_;
203#endif
204
205 friend class String;
206 friend class IterableSubString;
207 } V8_OBJECT_INNER_CLASS_END;
208
209 template <typename IsolateT>
210 EXPORT_TEMPLATE_DECLARE(V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE)
211 void MakeThin(IsolateT* isolate, Tagged<String> canonical);
212
213 template <typename Char>
214 V8_INLINE base::Vector<const Char> GetCharVector(
215 const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc);
216
217 // Get chars from sequential or external strings. May only be called when a
218 // SharedStringAccessGuard is not needed (i.e. on the main thread or on
219 // read-only strings).
220 template <typename Char>
221 inline const Char* GetDirectStringChars(
222 const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc) const;
223
224 // Get chars from sequential or external strings.
225 template <typename Char>
226 inline const Char* GetDirectStringChars(
227 const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc,
228 const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard) const;
229
230 // Returns the address of the character at an offset into this string.
231 // Requires: this->IsFlat()
232 const uint8_t* AddressOfCharacterAt(int start_index,
233 const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc);
234
235 inline int32_t length() const;
236 inline int32_t length(AcquireLoadTag) const;
237
238 inline void set_length(int32_t hash);
239 inline void set_length(int32_t hash, ReleaseStoreTag);
240
241 // Returns whether this string has only one-byte chars, i.e. all of them can
242 // be one-byte encoded. This might be the case even if the string is
243 // two-byte. Such strings may appear when the embedder prefers
244 // two-byte external representations even for one-byte data.
245 inline bool IsOneByteRepresentation() const;
246 inline bool IsTwoByteRepresentation() const;
247
248 // Cons and slices have an encoding flag that may not represent the actual
249 // encoding of the underlying string. This is taken into account here.
250 // This function is static because that helps it get inlined.
251 // Requires: string.IsFlat()
252 static inline bool IsOneByteRepresentationUnderneath(Tagged<String> string);
253
254 // Get and set individual two byte chars in the string.
255 inline void Set(int index, uint16_t value);
256 // Get individual two byte char in the string. Repeated calls
257 // to this method are not efficient unless the string is flat.
258 // If it is called from a background thread, the LocalIsolate version should
259 // be used.
260 V8_INLINE uint16_t Get(int index) const;
261 V8_INLINE uint16_t Get(int index, Isolate* isolate) const;
262 V8_INLINE uint16_t Get(int index, LocalIsolate* local_isolate) const;
263 // Method to pass down the access_guard. Useful for recursive calls such as
264 // ThinStrings where we go String::Get into ThinString::Get into String::Get
265 // again for the internalized string.
266 V8_INLINE uint16_t
267 Get(int index, const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard) const;
268
269 // ES6 section 7.1.3.1 ToNumber Applied to the String Type
270 static Handle<Object> ToNumber(Isolate* isolate, Handle<String> subject);
271
272 // Flattens the string. Checks first inline to see if it is
273 // necessary. Does nothing if the string is not a cons string.
274 // Flattening allocates a sequential string with the same data as
275 // the given string and mutates the cons string to a degenerate
276 // form, where the first component is the new sequential string and
277 // the second component is the empty string. If allocation fails,
278 // this function returns a failure. If flattening succeeds, this
279 // function returns the sequential string that is now the first
280 // component of the cons string.
281 //
282 // Degenerate cons strings are handled specially by the garbage
283 // collector (see IsShortcutCandidate).
284
285 static V8_INLINE Handle<String> Flatten(
286 Isolate* isolate, Handle<String> string,
287 AllocationType allocation = AllocationType::kYoung);
288 static V8_INLINE Handle<String> Flatten(
289 LocalIsolate* isolate, Handle<String> string,
290 AllocationType allocation = AllocationType::kYoung);
291
292 // Tries to return the content of a flat string as a structure holding either
293 // a flat vector of char or of base::uc16.
294 // If the string isn't flat, and therefore doesn't have flat content, the
295 // returned structure will report so, and can't provide a vector of either
296 // kind.
297 // When using a SharedStringAccessGuard, the guard's must outlive the
298 // returned FlatContent.
299 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE V8_INLINE FlatContent
300 GetFlatContent(const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc);
301 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE V8_INLINE FlatContent
302 GetFlatContent(const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc,
303 const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded&);
304
305 // Returns the parent of a sliced string or first part of a flat cons string.
306 // Requires: StringShape(this).IsIndirect() && this->IsFlat()
307 inline Tagged<String> GetUnderlying() const;
308
309 // Shares the string. Checks inline if the string is already shared or can be
310 // shared by transitioning its map in-place. If neither is possible, flattens
311 // and copies into a new shared sequential string.
312 static inline Handle<String> Share(Isolate* isolate, Handle<String> string);
313
314 // String relational comparison, implemented according to ES6 section 7.2.11
315 // Abstract Relational Comparison (step 5): The comparison of Strings uses a
316 // simple lexicographic ordering on sequences of code unit values. There is no
317 // attempt to use the more complex, semantically oriented definitions of
318 // character or string equality and collating order defined in the Unicode
319 // specification. Therefore String values that are canonically equal according
320 // to the Unicode standard could test as unequal. In effect this algorithm
321 // assumes that both Strings are already in normalized form. Also, note that
322 // for strings containing supplementary characters, lexicographic ordering on
323 // sequences of UTF-16 code unit values differs from that on sequences of code
324 // point values.
325 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT static ComparisonResult Compare(Isolate* isolate,
326 Handle<String> x,
327 Handle<String> y);
328
329 // Perform ES6 21.1.3.8, including checking arguments.
330 static Tagged<Object> IndexOf(Isolate* isolate, Handle<Object> receiver,
331 Handle<Object> search, Handle<Object> position);
332 // Perform string match of pattern on subject, starting at start index.
333 // Caller must ensure that 0 <= start_index <= sub->length(), as this does not
334 // check any arguments.
335 static int IndexOf(Isolate* isolate, Handle<String> receiver,
336 Handle<String> search, int start_index);
337
338 static Tagged<Object> LastIndexOf(Isolate* isolate, Handle<Object> receiver,
339 Handle<Object> search,
340 Handle<Object> position);
341
342 // Encapsulates logic related to a match and its capture groups as required
343 // by GetSubstitution.
344 class Match {
345 public:
346 virtual Handle<String> GetMatch() = 0;
347 virtual Handle<String> GetPrefix() = 0;
348 virtual Handle<String> GetSuffix() = 0;
349
350 // A named capture can be unmatched (either not specified in the pattern,
351 // or specified but unmatched in the current string), or matched.
352 enum CaptureState { UNMATCHED, MATCHED };
353
354 virtual int CaptureCount() = 0;
355 virtual bool HasNamedCaptures() = 0;
356 virtual MaybeHandle<String> GetCapture(int i, bool* capture_exists) = 0;
357 virtual MaybeHandle<String> GetNamedCapture(Handle<String> name,
358 CaptureState* state) = 0;
359
360 virtual ~Match() = default;
361 };
362
363 // ES#sec-getsubstitution
364 // GetSubstitution(matched, str, position, captures, replacement)
365 // Expand the $-expressions in the string and return a new string with
366 // the result.
367 // A {start_index} can be passed to specify where to start scanning the
368 // replacement string.
369 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT static MaybeHandle<String> GetSubstitution(
370 Isolate* isolate, Match* match, Handle<String> replacement,
371 int start_index = 0);
372
373 // String equality operations.
374 inline bool Equals(Tagged<String> other) const;
375 inline static bool Equals(Isolate* isolate, Handle<String> one,
376 Handle<String> two);
377
378 enum class EqualityType { kWholeString, kPrefix, kNoLengthCheck };
379
380 // Check if this string matches the given vector of characters, either as a
381 // whole string or just a prefix.
382 //
383 // The Isolate is passed as "evidence" that this call is on the main thread,
384 // and to distiguish from the LocalIsolate overload.
385 template <EqualityType kEqType = EqualityType::kWholeString, typename Char>
386 inline bool IsEqualTo(base::Vector<const Char> str, Isolate* isolate) const;
387
388 // Check if this string matches the given vector of characters, either as a
389 // whole string or just a prefix.
390 //
391 // This is main-thread only, like the Isolate* overload, but additionally
392 // computes the PtrComprCageBase for IsEqualToImpl.
393 template <EqualityType kEqType = EqualityType::kWholeString, typename Char>
394 inline bool IsEqualTo(base::Vector<const Char> str) const;
395
396 // Check if this string matches the given vector of characters, either as a
397 // whole string or just a prefix.
398 //
399 // The LocalIsolate is passed to provide access to the string access lock,
400 // which is taken when reading the string's contents on a background thread.
401 template <EqualityType kEqType = EqualityType::kWholeString, typename Char>
402 inline bool IsEqualTo(base::Vector<const Char> str,
403 LocalIsolate* isolate) const;

408 // Returns true if the |str| is a valid ECMAScript identifier.
409 static bool IsIdentifier(Isolate* isolate, Handle<String> str);
410
411 // Return a UTF8 representation of the string. The string is null
412 // terminated but may optionally contain nulls. Length is returned
413 // in length_output if length_output is not a null pointer The string
414 // should be nearly flat, otherwise the performance of this method may
415 // be very slow (quadratic in the length). Setting robustness_flag to
416 // ROBUST_STRING_TRAVERSAL invokes behaviour that is robust This means it
417 // handles unexpected data without causing assert failures and it does not
418 // do any heap allocations. This is useful when printing stack traces.
419 std::unique_ptr<char[]> ToCString(AllowNullsFlag allow_nulls,
420 RobustnessFlag robustness_flag, int offset,
421 int length, int* length_output = nullptr);
422 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE std::unique_ptr<char[]> ToCString(
423 AllowNullsFlag allow_nulls = DISALLOW_NULLS,
424 RobustnessFlag robustness_flag = FAST_STRING_TRAVERSAL,
425 int* length_output = nullptr);

439 // Conversion.
440 // "array index": an index allowed by the ES spec for JSArrays.
441 inline bool AsArrayIndex(uint32_t* index);
442
443 // This is used for calculating array indices but differs from an
444 // Array Index in the regard that this does not support the full
445 // array index range. This only supports positive numbers less than
446 // or equal to INT_MAX.
447 //
448 // String::AsArrayIndex might be a better fit if you're looking to
449 // calculate the array index.
450 //
451 // if val < 0 or val > INT_MAX, returns -1
452 // if 0 <= val <= INT_MAX, returns val
453 static int32_t ToArrayIndex(Address addr);
454
455 // "integer index": the string is the decimal representation of an
456 // integer in the range of a size_t. Useful for TypedArray accesses.
457 inline bool AsIntegerIndex(size_t* index);

468 // Printing utility functions.
469 // - PrintUC16 prints the raw string contents to the given stream.
470 // Non-printable characters are formatted as hex, but otherwise the string
471 // is printed as-is.
472 // - StringShortPrint and StringPrint have extra formatting: they add a
473 // prefix and suffix depending on the string kind, may add other information
474 // such as the string heap object address, may truncate long strings, etc.
475 const char* PrefixForDebugPrint() const;
476 const char* SuffixForDebugPrint() const;
477 void StringShortPrint(StringStream* accumulator);
478 void PrintUC16(std::ostream& os, int start = 0, int end = -1);
479 void PrintUC16(StringStream* accumulator, int start, int end);

492 // Max char codes.
493 static const int32_t kMaxOneByteCharCode = unibrow::Latin1::kMaxChar;
494 static const uint32_t kMaxOneByteCharCodeU = unibrow::Latin1::kMaxChar;
495 static const int kMaxUtf16CodeUnit = 0xffff;
496 static const uint32_t kMaxUtf16CodeUnitU = kMaxUtf16CodeUnit;
497 static const base::uc32 kMaxCodePoint = 0x10ffff;
498
499 // Maximal string length.
500 // The max length is different on 32 and 64 bit platforms. Max length for
501 // 32-bit platforms is ~268.4M chars. On 64-bit platforms, max length is
502 // ~536.8M chars.
503 // See include/v8.h for the definition.
504 static const int kMaxLength = v8::String::kMaxLength;
505
506 // Max length for computing hash. For strings longer than this limit the
507 // string length is used as the hash value.
508 static const int kMaxHashCalcLength = 16383;
509
510 // Limit for truncation in short printing.
511 static const int kMaxShortPrintLength = 1024;

517 int to);

522 // Returns true if this string has no unpaired surrogates and false otherwise.
523 static inline bool IsWellFormedUnicode(Isolate* isolate,
524 Handle<String> string);
525
526 static inline bool IsAscii(const char* chars, int length) {
527 return IsAscii(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(chars), length);
528 }
529
530 static inline bool IsAscii(const uint8_t* chars, int length) {
531 return NonAsciiStart(chars, length) >= length;
532 }
533
534 static inline int NonOneByteStart(const base::uc16* chars, int length) {
535 DCHECK(IsAligned(reinterpret_cast<Address>(chars), sizeof(base::uc16)));
536 const uint16_t* start = chars;
537 const uint16_t* limit = chars + length;
538
539 if (static_cast<size_t>(length) >= kUIntptrSize) {
540 // Check unaligned chars.
541 while (!IsAligned(reinterpret_cast<Address>(chars), kUIntptrSize)) {
542 if (*chars > unibrow::Latin1::kMaxChar) {
543 return static_cast<int>(chars - start);
544 }
545 ++chars;
546 }
547
548 // Check aligned words.
549 static_assert(unibrow::Latin1::kMaxChar == 0xFF);
550#ifdef V8_TARGET_LITTLE_ENDIAN
551 const uintptr_t non_one_byte_mask = kUintptrAllBitsSet / 0xFFFF * 0xFF00;
552#else
553 const uintptr_t non_one_byte_mask = kUintptrAllBitsSet / 0xFFFF * 0x00FF;
554#endif
555 while (chars + sizeof(uintptr_t) <= limit) {
556 if (*reinterpret_cast<const uintptr_t*>(chars) & non_one_byte_mask) {
557 break;
558 }
559 chars += (sizeof(uintptr_t) / sizeof(base::uc16));
560 }
561 }
562
563 // Check remaining unaligned chars, or find non-one-byte char in word.
564 while (chars < limit) {
565 if (*chars > unibrow::Latin1::kMaxChar) {
566 return static_cast<int>(chars - start);
567 }
568 ++chars;
569 }
570
571 return static_cast<int>(chars - start);
572 }
573
574 static inline bool IsOneByte(const base::uc16* chars, int length) {
575 return NonOneByteStart(chars, length) >= length;
576 }

582 Tagged<String> string,

584

586 static inline Tagged<ConsString> VisitFlat(

588 const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard);

629 GetImpl(int index, const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard) const;
630
631 // Implementation of the IsEqualTo() public methods. Do not use directly.
632 template <EqualityType kEqType, typename Char>
633 V8_INLINE bool IsEqualToImpl(
634 base::Vector<const Char> str,
635 const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard) const;
636
637 // Out-of-line IsEqualToImpl for ConsString.
638 template <typename Char>
639 V8_NOINLINE static bool IsConsStringEqualToImpl(
640 Tagged<ConsString> string, base::Vector<const Char> str,
641 const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard);
642
643 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE static Handle<String> SlowFlatten(
644 Isolate* isolate, Handle<ConsString> cons, AllocationType allocation);
645
646 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE V8_INLINE static base::Optional<FlatContent>
647 TryGetFlatContentFromDirectString(const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc,
648 Tagged<String> string, int offset,
649 int length,
650 const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded&);
651 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE FlatContent
652 SlowGetFlatContent(const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc,
653 const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded&);
654
655 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE static Handle<String> SlowShare(Isolate* isolate,
656 Handle<String> source);
657
658 // Slow case of String::Equals. This implementation works on any strings
659 // but it is most efficient on strings that are almost flat.
660 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool SlowEquals(Tagged<String> other) const;
661 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool SlowEquals(
662 Tagged<String> other, const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded&) const;
663
664 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE static bool SlowEquals(Isolate* isolate, Handle<String> one,
665 Handle<String> two);
666
667 // Slow case of AsArrayIndex.
668 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool SlowAsArrayIndex(uint32_t* index);
669 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool SlowAsIntegerIndex(size_t* index);
670
671 // Compute and set the hash code.
672 // The value returned is always a computed hash, even if the value stored is
673 // a forwarding index.
674 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE uint32_t ComputeAndSetRawHash();
675 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE uint32_t
676 ComputeAndSetRawHash(const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded&);
677
678 int32_t length_;
679} V8_OBJECT_END;
680
681template <>
682struct ObjectTraits<String> {
683 static constexpr int kHeaderSize = sizeof(String);
684
685 // There are several defining limits imposed by our current implementation:
686 // - any string's length must fit into a Smi.
687 static_assert(String::kMaxLength <= kSmiMaxValue,
688 "String length must fit into a Smi");
689 // - adding two string lengths must still fit into a 32-bit int without
690 // overflow
691 static_assert(String::kMaxLength * 2 <= kMaxInt,
692 "String::kMaxLength * 2 must fit into an int32");
693 // - any heap object's size in bytes must be able to fit into a Smi, because
694 // its space on the heap might be filled with a Filler; for strings this
695 // means SeqTwoByteString::kMaxSize must be able to fit into a Smi.
696 static_assert(String::kMaxLength * 2 + kHeaderSize <= kSmiMaxValue,
697 "String object size in bytes must fit into a Smi");
698 // - any heap object's size in bytes must be able to fit into an int, because
699 // that's what our object handling code uses almost everywhere.
700 static_assert(String::kMaxLength * 2 + kHeaderSize <= kMaxInt,
701 "String object size in bytes must fit into an int");
702};
703
704// clang-format off
705extern template EXPORT_TEMPLATE_DECLARE(V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE) void
706 String::WriteToFlat(Tagged<String> source, uint8_t* sink, int from, int to);
707extern template EXPORT_TEMPLATE_DECLARE(V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE) void
708 String::WriteToFlat(Tagged<String> source, uint16_t* sink, int from,
709 int to);
710extern template EXPORT_TEMPLATE_DECLARE(V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE) void
711 String::WriteToFlat(Tagged<String> source, uint8_t* sink, int from, int to,
712 const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded&);
713extern template EXPORT_TEMPLATE_DECLARE(V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE) void
714 String::WriteToFlat(Tagged<String> source, uint16_t* sink, int from, int to,
715 const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded&);
716// clang-format on
717
718class SubStringRange {
719 public:
720 inline SubStringRange(Tagged<String> string,
721 const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc, int first = 0,
722 int length = -1);
723 class iterator;
724 inline iterator begin();
725 inline iterator end();
726
727 private:
728 Tagged<String> string_;
729 int first_;
730 int length_;
731 const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc_;
732};

734// The SeqString abstract class captures sequential string values.
735class SeqString : public String {
736 public:
737 // Truncate the string in-place if possible and return the result.
738 // In case of new_length == 0, the empty string is returned without
739 // truncating the original string.
740 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT static Handle<String> Truncate(Isolate* isolate,
741 Handle<SeqString> string,
742 int new_length);
743
744 struct DataAndPaddingSizes {
745 const int data_size;
746 const int padding_size;
747 bool operator==(const DataAndPaddingSizes& other) const {
748 return data_size == other.data_size && padding_size == other.padding_size;
749 }
750 };
751 DataAndPaddingSizes GetDataAndPaddingSizes() const;
752
753 // Zero out only the padding bytes of this string.
754 void ClearPadding();
755
756 DECL_CAST(SeqString)
757 EXPORT_DECL_VERIFIER(SeqString)
758};

764} V8_OBJECT_END;

766// The OneByteString class captures sequential one-byte string objects.
767// Each character in the OneByteString is an one-byte character.
768V8_OBJECT class SeqOneByteString : public SeqString {
769 public:
770 static const bool kHasOneByteEncoding = true;
771 using Char = uint8_t;
772
773 V8_INLINE static constexpr int32_t DataSizeFor(int32_t length);
774 V8_INLINE static constexpr int32_t SizeFor(int32_t length);
775
776 // Dispatched behavior. The non SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded method is also
777 // defined for convenience and it will check that the access guard is not
778 // needed.
779 inline uint8_t Get(int index) const;
780 inline uint8_t Get(int index,
781 const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard) const;
782 inline void SeqOneByteStringSet(int index, uint16_t value);
783 inline void SeqOneByteStringSetChars(int index, const uint8_t* string,
784 int length);
785
786 // Get the address of the characters in this string.
787 inline Address GetCharsAddress() const;
788
789 // Get a pointer to the characters of the string. May only be called when a
790 // SharedStringAccessGuard is not needed (i.e. on the main thread or on
791 // read-only strings).
792 inline uint8_t* GetChars(const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc);
793
794 // Get a pointer to the characters of the string.
795 inline uint8_t* GetChars(const DisallowGarbageCollection& no_gc,
796 const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard);
797
798 DataAndPaddingSizes GetDataAndPaddingSizes() const;
799
800 // Initializes padding bytes. Potentially zeros tail of the payload too!
801 inline void clear_padding_destructively(int length);
802
803 // Maximal memory usage for a single sequential one-byte string.
804 static const int kMaxCharsSize = kMaxLength;
805
806 inline int AllocatedSize() const;
807
808 // A SeqOneByteString have different maps depending on whether it is shared.
809 static inline bool IsCompatibleMap(Tagged<Map> map, ReadOnlyRoots roots);
810
811 class BodyDescriptor;
812
813 DECL_CAST(SeqOneByteString)
814
815 private:
816 friend struct OffsetsForDebug;
817 friend class CodeStubAssembler;
818 friend class ToDirectStringAssembler;
819 friend class IntlBuiltinsAssembler;
820 friend class StringBuiltinsAssembler;
821 friend class StringFromCharCodeAssembler;
822 friend class maglev::MaglevAssembler;
823 friend class compiler::AccessBuilder;
824 friend class TorqueGeneratedSeqOneByteStringAsserts;
825
826 FLEXIBLE_ARRAY_MEMBER(Char, chars);
827} V8_OBJECT_END;

829template <>
830struct ObjectTraits<SeqOneByteString> {
831 using BodyDescriptor = SeqOneByteString::BodyDescriptor;
832
833 static constexpr int kHeaderSize = sizeof(SeqOneByteString);
834 static constexpr int kMaxSize =
835 OBJECT_POINTER_ALIGN(SeqOneByteString::kMaxCharsSize + kHeaderSize);
836
837 static_assert(static_cast<int>((kMaxSize - kHeaderSize) /
838 sizeof(SeqOneByteString::Char)) >=
839 String::kMaxLength);
840};

876 static const int kMaxCharsSize = kMaxLength * sizeof(Char);

902template <>
903struct ObjectTraits<SeqTwoByteString> {

914
915// The ConsString class describes string values built by using the
916// addition operator on strings. A ConsString is a pair where the
917// first and second components are pointers to other string values.
918// One or both components of a ConsString can be pointers to other
919// ConsStrings, creating a binary tree of ConsStrings where the leaves
920// are non-ConsString string values. The string value represented by
921// a ConsString can be obtained by concatenating the leaf string
922// values in a left-to-right depth-first traversal of the tree.
923V8_OBJECT class ConsString : public String {
924 public:
925 inline Tagged<String> first() const;
926 inline void set_first(Tagged<String> value,
927 WriteBarrierMode mode = UPDATE_WRITE_BARRIER);
928
929 inline Tagged<String> second() const;
930 inline void set_second(Tagged<String> value,
931 WriteBarrierMode mode = UPDATE_WRITE_BARRIER);
932
933 // Doesn't check that the result is a string, even in debug mode. This is
934 // useful during GC where the mark bits confuse the checks.
935 inline Tagged<Object> unchecked_first() const;
936
937 // Doesn't check that the result is a string, even in debug mode. This is
938 // useful during GC where the mark bits confuse the checks.
939 inline Tagged<Object> unchecked_second() const;
940
941 V8_INLINE bool IsFlat() const;
942
943 // Dispatched behavior.
944 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE uint16_t
945 Get(int index, const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard) const;
946
947 // Minimum length for a cons string.
948 static const int kMinLength = 13;
949
950 DECL_CAST(ConsString)
951 DECL_VERIFIER(ConsString)
952
953 private:
954 friend struct ObjectTraits<ConsString>;
955 friend struct OffsetsForDebug;
956 friend class V8HeapExplorer;
957 friend class CodeStubAssembler;
958 friend class ToDirectStringAssembler;
959 friend class StringBuiltinsAssembler;
960 friend class maglev::MaglevAssembler;
961 friend class compiler::AccessBuilder;
962 friend class TorqueGeneratedConsStringAsserts;
963
964 friend Tagged<String> String::GetUnderlying() const;
965
966 TaggedMember<String> first_;
967 TaggedMember<String> second_;
968} V8_OBJECT_END;
969
970template <>
971struct ObjectTraits<ConsString> {
972 using BodyDescriptor =
973 FixedBodyDescriptor<offsetof(ConsString, first_), sizeof(ConsString),
974 sizeof(ConsString)>;
975};
976
977// The ThinString class describes string objects that are just references
978// to another string object. They are used for in-place internalization when
979// the original string cannot actually be internalized in-place: in these
980// cases, the original string is converted to a ThinString pointing at its
981// internalized version (which is allocated as a new object).
982// In terms of memory layout and most algorithms operating on strings,
983// ThinStrings can be thought of as "one-part cons strings".
984V8_OBJECT class ThinString : public String {
985 public:
986 inline Tagged<String> actual() const;
987 inline void set_actual(Tagged<String> value,
988 WriteBarrierMode mode = UPDATE_WRITE_BARRIER);
989
990 inline Tagged<HeapObject> unchecked_actual() const;
991
992 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE uint16_t
993 Get(int index, const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard) const;
994
995 DECL_CAST(ThinString)
996 DECL_VERIFIER(ThinString)
997
998 private:
999 friend struct ObjectTraits<ThinString>;
1000 friend struct OffsetsForDebug;
1001 friend class V8HeapExplorer;
1002 friend class CodeStubAssembler;
1003 friend class ToDirectStringAssembler;
1004 friend class StringBuiltinsAssembler;
1005 friend class maglev::MaglevAssembler;
1006 friend class maglev::CheckedInternalizedString;
1007 friend class compiler::AccessBuilder;
1008 friend class FullStringForwardingTableCleaner;
1009 friend class TorqueGeneratedThinStringAsserts;
1010
1011 friend Tagged<String> String::GetUnderlying() const;
1012
1013 TaggedMember<String> actual_;
1014} V8_OBJECT_END;
1015
1016template <>
1017struct ObjectTraits<ThinString> {
1018 using BodyDescriptor =
1019 FixedBodyDescriptor<offsetof(ThinString, actual_), sizeof(ThinString),
1020 sizeof(ThinString)>;
1021};
1022
1023// The Sliced String class describes strings that are substrings of another
1024// sequential string. The motivation is to save time and memory when creating
1025// a substring. A Sliced String is described as a pointer to the parent,
1026// the offset from the start of the parent string and the length. Using
1027// a Sliced String therefore requires unpacking of the parent string and
1028// adding the offset to the start address. A substring of a Sliced String
1029// are not nested since the double indirection is simplified when creating
1030// such a substring.
1031// Currently missing features are:
1032// - truncating sliced string to enable otherwise unneeded parent to be GC'ed.
1033V8_OBJECT class SlicedString : public String {
1034 public:
1035 inline Tagged<String> parent() const;
1036 inline void set_parent(Tagged<String> parent,
1037 WriteBarrierMode mode = UPDATE_WRITE_BARRIER);
1038
1039 inline int32_t offset() const;
1040 inline void set_offset(int32_t offset);
1041
1042 // Dispatched behavior.
1043 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE uint16_t
1044 Get(int index, const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard) const;
1045
1046 // Minimum length for a sliced string.
1047 static const int kMinLength = 13;
1048
1049 DECL_CAST(SlicedString)
1050 DECL_VERIFIER(SlicedString)
1051 private:
1052 friend struct ObjectTraits<SlicedString>;
1053 friend struct OffsetsForDebug;
1054 friend class V8HeapExplorer;
1055 friend class CodeStubAssembler;
1056 friend class SandboxTesting;
1057 friend class ToDirectStringAssembler;
1058 friend class maglev::MaglevAssembler;
1059 friend class compiler::AccessBuilder;
1060 friend class TorqueGeneratedSlicedStringAsserts;
1061
1062 friend Tagged<String> String::GetUnderlying() const;
1063
1064 TaggedMember<String> parent_;
1065 TaggedMember<Smi> offset_;
1066} V8_OBJECT_END;
1067
1068template <>
1069struct ObjectTraits<SlicedString> {
1070 using BodyDescriptor =
1071 FixedBodyDescriptor<offsetof(SlicedString, parent_), sizeof(SlicedString),
1072 sizeof(SlicedString)>;
1073};
1074
1075// TODO(leszeks): Build this out into a full V8 class.
1076V8_OBJECT class UncachedExternalString : public String {
1077 protected:
1078 ExternalPointerMember<kExternalStringResourceTag> resource_;
1079} V8_OBJECT_END;
1080
1081// The ExternalString class describes string values that are backed by
1082// a string resource that lies outside the V8 heap. ExternalStrings
1083// consist of the length field common to all strings, a pointer to the
1084// external resource. It is important to ensure (externally) that the
1085// resource is not deallocated while the ExternalString is live in the
1086// V8 heap.
1087//
1088// The API expects that all ExternalStrings are created through the
1089// API. Therefore, ExternalStrings should not be used internally.
1090V8_OBJECT class ExternalString : public UncachedExternalString {
1091 public:
1092 class BodyDescriptor;
1093
1094 DECL_CAST(ExternalString)
1095 DECL_VERIFIER(ExternalString)
1096
1097 inline void InitExternalPointerFields(Isolate* isolate);
1098 inline void VisitExternalPointers(ObjectVisitor* visitor);
1099
1100 // Return whether the external string data pointer is not cached.
1101 inline bool is_uncached() const;
1102 // Size in bytes of the external payload.
1103 int ExternalPayloadSize() const;
1104
1105 // Used in the serializer/deserializer.
1106 inline Address resource_as_address() const;
1107 inline void set_address_as_resource(Isolate* isolate, Address address);
1108 inline uint32_t GetResourceRefForDeserialization();
1109 inline void SetResourceRefForSerialization(uint32_t ref);
1110
1111 // Disposes string's resource object if it has not already been disposed.
1112 inline void DisposeResource(Isolate* isolate);
1113
1114 void InitExternalPointerFieldsDuringExternalization(Tagged<Map> new_map,
1115 Isolate* isolate);
1116
1117 private:
1118 friend ObjectTraits<ExternalString>;
1119 friend struct OffsetsForDebug;
1120 friend class CodeStubAssembler;
1121 friend class compiler::AccessBuilder;
1122 friend class TorqueGeneratedExternalStringAsserts;
1123
1124 protected:
1125 ExternalPointerMember<kExternalStringResourceDataTag> resource_data_;
1126} V8_OBJECT_END;
1127
1128template <>
1129struct ObjectTraits<ExternalString> {
1130 using BodyDescriptor = ExternalString::BodyDescriptor;
1131
1132 static_assert(offsetof(ExternalString, resource_) ==
1133 Internals::kStringResourceOffset);
1134};
1135
1136// The ExternalOneByteString class is an external string backed by an
1137// one-byte string.
1138V8_OBJECT class ExternalOneByteString : public ExternalString {
1139 public:
1140 static const bool kHasOneByteEncoding = true;
1141
1142 using Resource = v8::String::ExternalOneByteStringResource;
1143
1144 // The underlying resource.
1145 inline const Resource* resource() const;
1146
1147 // It is assumed that the previous resource is null. If it is not null, then
1148 // it is the responsability of the caller the handle the previous resource.
1149 inline void SetResource(Isolate* isolate, const Resource* buffer);
1150
1151 // Used only during serialization.
1152 inline void set_resource(Isolate* isolate, const Resource* buffer);
1153
1154 // Update the pointer cache to the external character array.
1155 // The cached pointer is always valid, as the external character array does =
1156 // not move during lifetime. Deserialization is the only exception, after
1157 // which the pointer cache has to be refreshed.
1158 inline void update_data_cache(Isolate* isolate);
1159
1160 inline const uint8_t* GetChars() const;
1161
1162 // Dispatched behavior.
1163 inline uint8_t Get(int index,
1164 const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard) const;
1165
1166 DECL_CAST(ExternalOneByteString)
1167
1168 private:
1169 // The underlying resource as a non-const pointer.
1170 inline Resource* mutable_resource();
1171} V8_OBJECT_END;
1172
1173static_assert(sizeof(ExternalOneByteString) == sizeof(ExternalString));

1175// The ExternalTwoByteString class is an external string backed by a UTF-16
1176// encoded string.
1177V8_OBJECT class ExternalTwoByteString : public ExternalString {
1178 public:
1179 static const bool kHasOneByteEncoding = false;
1180
1181 using Resource = v8::String::ExternalStringResource;
1182
1183 // The underlying string resource.
1184 inline const Resource* resource() const;
1185
1186 // It is assumed that the previous resource is null. If it is not null, then
1187 // it is the responsability of the caller the handle the previous resource.
1188 inline void SetResource(Isolate* isolate, const Resource* buffer);
1189
1190 // Used only during serialization.
1191 inline void set_resource(Isolate* isolate, const Resource* buffer);
1192
1193 // Update the pointer cache to the external character array.
1194 // The cached pointer is always valid, as the external character array does =
1195 // not move during lifetime. Deserialization is the only exception, after
1196 // which the pointer cache has to be refreshed.
1197 inline void update_data_cache(Isolate* isolate);
1198
1199 inline const uint16_t* GetChars() const;

1203 int index, const SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard) const;

1207

1213} V8_OBJECT_END;

1217// A flat string reader provides random access to the contents of a
1218// string independent of the character width of the string. The handle
1219// must be valid as long as the reader is being used.
1220// Not safe to use from concurrent background threads.
1221class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE FlatStringReader : public Relocatable {
1222 public:
1223 FlatStringReader(Isolate* isolate, Handle<String> str);
1224 void PostGarbageCollection() override;
1225 inline base::uc32 Get(int index) const;
1226 template <typename Char>
1227 inline Char Get(int index) const;
1228 int length() const { return length_; }
1229
1230 private:
1231 Handle<String> str_;
1232 bool is_one_byte_;
1233 int const length_;
1234 const void* start_;
1235};
1236
1237// This maintains an off-stack representation of the stack frames required
1238// to traverse a ConsString, allowing an entirely iterative and restartable
1239// traversal of the entire string
1240class ConsStringIterator {
1241 public:
1242 inline ConsStringIterator() = default;
1243 inline explicit ConsStringIterator(Tagged<ConsString> cons_string,
1244 int offset = 0) {
1245 Reset(cons_string, offset);
1246 }
1247 ConsStringIterator(const ConsStringIterator&) = delete;
1248 ConsStringIterator& operator=(const ConsStringIterator&) = delete;
1249 inline void Reset(Tagged<ConsString> cons_string, int offset = 0) {
1250 depth_ = 0;
1251 // Next will always return nullptr.
1252 if (cons_string.is_null()) return;
1253 Initialize(cons_string, offset);
1254 }
1255 // Returns nullptr when complete. The offset_out parameter will be set to the
1256 // offset within the returned segment that the user should start looking at,
1257 // to match the offset passed into the constructor or Reset -- this will only
1258 // be non-zero immediately after construction or Reset, and only if those had
1259 // a non-zero offset.
1260 inline Tagged<String> Next(int* offset_out) {
1261 *offset_out = 0;
1262 if (depth_ == 0) return Tagged<String>();
1263 return Continue(offset_out);
1264 }
1265
1266 private:
1267 static const int kStackSize = 32;
1268 // Use a mask instead of doing modulo operations for stack wrapping.
1269 static const int kDepthMask = kStackSize - 1;
1270 static_assert(base::bits::IsPowerOfTwo(kStackSize),
1271 "kStackSize must be power of two");
1272 static inline int OffsetForDepth(int depth);
1273
1274 inline void PushLeft(Tagged<ConsString> string);
1275 inline void PushRight(Tagged<ConsString> string);
1276 inline void AdjustMaximumDepth();
1277 inline void Pop();
1278 inline bool StackBlown() { return maximum_depth_ - depth_ == kStackSize; }
1279 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void Initialize(Tagged<ConsString> cons_string, int offset);
1280 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE Tagged<String> Continue(int* offset_out);
1281 Tagged<String> NextLeaf(bool* blew_stack);
1282 Tagged<String> Search(int* offset_out);
1283
1284 // Stack must always contain only frames for which right traversal
1285 // has not yet been performed.
1286 Tagged<ConsString> frames_[kStackSize];
1287 Tagged<ConsString> root_;
1288 int depth_;
1289 int maximum_depth_;
1290 int consumed_;
1291};
